fields.description:
I've found myself creating lots of new Alloy projects from the command line, which first requires creating a Ti project, of course. To save some time, I created a shell script that takes a app name, runs {{ti create}} with some sensible defaults, and then runs {{alloy new}} on the new Titanium project folder.

This has been especially useful in conjunction with ALOY-1115 to quickly create a project from one of the test apps.

It would be useful, I think, if the Alloy CLI's {{create}} command included an option to create a new Titanium project, if one doesn't exist. This could either be an opt-in CLI switch, or maybe via a prompt ("No Titanium project found, would you like to create one?") instead of just throwing an error ("Resources not found"), which is not that helpful.
fields.summary: Alloy CLI create option to generate a Titanium project
